intro: Diosma rubra, commonly known as the redstem diosma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes nightshades, and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and it often forms dense mats or low shrubs. Diosma rubra is adapted to arid environments and is often found in desert or semi-desert regions.
